title: (Metal) Apocalyptica - Inquisition Symphony
description:
Apocalyptica is a Finnish cello metal band, composed of classically trained cellists. Three of the cellists are graduates of the Sibelius Academy in Helsinki, Finland. Their music features elements from cello metal, neo-classical metal, progressive metal and symphonic metal.



Inquisition Symphony is the second studio album by the Finnish cello rock band Apocalyptica. It was released September 22, 1998. The album had branched from their previous effort and contains four Metallica covers; "For Whom the Bell Tolls", "Nothing Else Matters", "Fade to Black", and "One". Three more bands are covered on this album; Faith No More, Pantera, and Sepultura. Three compositions are originals from Apocalyptica bandleader Eicca Toppinen: "Harmageddon", "M.B.", and "Toreador". Max Lilja did the arrangements for "One".


1.  "Harmageddon" 
2.  "From Out of Nowhere" (from Faith No More&#039;s The Real Thing album) 
3.  "For Whom the Bell Tolls" (from Metallica&#039;s Ride the Lightning album) 
4.  "Nothing Else Matters" (from Metallica&#039;s Black Album) 
5.  "Refuse/Resist" (from Sepultura&#039;s Chaos A.D. album) 
6.  "M.B." (Metal Boogie) 
7.  "Inquisition Symphony" (from Sepultura&#039;s Schizophrenia album) 
8.  "Fade to Black" (from Metallica&#039;s Ride the Lightning album) 
9.  "Domination" (from Pantera&#039;s Cowboys from Hell album) 
10. "Toreador" 
11. "One" (from Metallica&#039;s ....And Justice for All album)
